Eligibility for travel concessions: age
	In section 93(7) of the Transport Act [1985 (c.67)](/id/ukpga/1985/67?view=plain "Go to item of legislation") (personseligible to receive travel concessions outside Greater London), for paragraph(a) there is substituted—
		persons who have attained the age of sixty years;”.
	In section 240(5) of the Greater London Authority Act [1999 (c.29)](/id/ukpga/1999/29?view=plain "Go to item of legislation") (personseligible to receive travel concessions in and around Greater London), forparagraph (a) there is substituted—
		who have attained the age of 60 years;”.
	In section 146 of the Transport Act [2000 (c.38)](/id/ukpga/2000/38?view=plain "Go to item of legislation") (mandatorytravel concessions outside Greater London), for the definition of “elderlyperson” there is substituted—
		““elderly person” means a person who has attained the age of 60 years,”.
	The appropriate Minister may by order provide that on and after 6th April2010 the enactments mentioned in subsections (1) to (3) shall have effect asif for the reference to the age of 60 years there were substituted a referenceto—
		in the case of a woman, her pensionable age,
		in the case of a man, the pensionable age of a woman born on the same day,
		(“pensionable age”, in each case, having the meaning given by the rules inparagraph 1 of Schedule 4 to the Pensions Act [1995 (c.26)](/id/ukpga/1995/26?view=plain "Go to item of legislation")).
	An order made under subsection (4) is to be made by statutory instrumentand is subject to annulment in pursuance of a resolution of either House ofParliament.
Commencement and transitional provision
	Section 1 shall come into force on such day as the appropriate Minister mayby order made by statutory instrument appoint, and different days may beappointed for different provisions and for different purposes.
	But an order providing for the commencement of section 1(2) must—
		provide for it to come into force on 1st April in any year, and
		be made before the 1st January immediately preceding that 1st April.
	After the making of an order providing for the commencement of section1(2), it is to be treated as if it were in force for the purposes of enteringinto arrangements under section 240(1) or (2) of the Greater London AuthorityAct [1999 (c. 29)](/id/ukpga/1999/29?view=plain "Go to item of legislation")which will apply during the financial year beginning on the day on whichsection 1(2) comes into force.
Short title, interpretation and extent
	This Act may be cited as the Travel Concessions (Eligibility) Act 2002.
	In this Act, “appropriate Minister” means—
		in relation to England, the Secretary of State,
		in relation to Wales, the National Assembly for Wales.
	This Act extends to England and Wales only.
